author: Cortex XSOAR

commands.description: Executes an Analytics query for data.
commands.name: azure-log-analytics-execute-query

commands.description: Tests connectivity to Azure Log Analytics.
commands.name: azure-log-analytics-test

commands.description: Gets the saved searches of the Log Analytics workspace.
commands.name: azure-log-analytics-list-saved-searches

commands.description: Gets a specified saved search from the Log Analytics workspace.
commands.name: azure-log-analytics-get-saved-search-by-id

commands.description: Creates or updates a saved search from the Log Analytics workspace.
commands.name: azure-log-analytics-create-or-update-saved-search

commands.description: Deletes a specified saved search in the Log Analytics workspace.
commands.name: azure-log-analytics-delete-saved-search

commands.description: Generate the login url used for Authorization code flow.
commands.name: azure-log-analytics-generate-login-url

commands.description: Run this command if for some reason you need to rerun the authentication process.
commands.name: azure-log-analytics-auth-reset

integration.description: Log Analytics is a service that helps you collect and analyze data generated by resources in your cloud and on-premises environments.
integration.name: Azure Log Analytics

playbook.description: Executes a query from a saved search in Azure Log Analytics.
playbook.name: Azure Log Analytics - Query From Saved Search

description: Log Analytics is a service that helps you collect and analyze data generated by resources in your cloud and on-premises environments.
name: Azure Log Analytics
readme:
Log Analytics enables you to edit and run log queries on data collected by your resources and analyze their results. 

## What does this pack do?

You can use Log Analytics queries to:
- Retrieve records that match particular criteria
- Identify trends
- Analyze patterns
- Provide various insights into your data

To access Azure Log Analytics, you need Cortex XSOAR authorization. For details, see https://xsoar.pan.dev/docs/reference/integrations/azure-log-analytics.

The **Azure Log Analytics - Query From Saved Search** playbook enables you to execute a query from a saved search in Azure Log Analytics.
